titleStmt.title: William Patrick to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6590

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To the Excelence the govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner William Patrick wold Respectifully Represent to your honr Excelence that he at the Ma^r^ch term ^1865^ of the Whitley Circuit Court that the granjury found an inditement against against him for an adultery and that he being unable to prove that he was not gilty just ^enterd his appran^ce^ &^ pled gilty and the court Renderd judgement against him for twenty dollars he states that the he served a tour in the servis of the united states and that he is a pore mand and has not the means to pay the judgement and to do justice to his famley
Wheare fore he pray that your Excelents Remit the fine and set aside the Judgment and and for all proper Releaf
Sworn to before me by Wm Patrick this day of June 1865
The under signed says that it they beleave that it wold be na act of charity to Remite the fine and ask your Excelence to Remitt the same

John Smith
Isaiah Bird
Jasper. T. Freeman
Joel Baker
Seth Freeman
P W Me
M, E, White
C L Creekmore
Alexr Litton
S P Browner
M L
M L Davis

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
Wm Patrick
$20,
Refused
